title: Daily Market Digest: February 25, 2026
subtitle: Market closes higher with AI and tech leading the charge

items.headline: U.S. Stocks Climb on AI Optimism and Economic Data
items.summary: U.S. equity markets closed higher on Wednesday, February 25, 2026, as investors rotated back into technology and artificial intelligence stocks. The rally was fueled by renewed optimism surrounding AI spending, easing concerns over software disruption, and positive economic indicators. Major indices advanced, with the Dow, S&P 500, and Nasdaq all finishing in positive territory.

items.headline: Cava Group Surges on Strong Earnings
items.summary: Shares of Cava Group ($CAVA) jumped 18% after the fast-casual Mediterranean restaurant chain reported better-than-expected profit and revenue for the latest quarter and issued upbeat FY2026 guidance.

items.headline: Axon Enterprise Beats Expectations
items.summary: Axon Enterprise ($AXON), the maker of Tasers and body cameras, leaped 16% after reporting stronger-than-anticipated quarterly profit and revenue, alongside a robust 27%-30% revenue growth projection for 2026.

items.headline: Intel Rises on Renewed Optimism
items.summary: Intel ($INTC) gained 5.71% to $46.12, driven by renewed optimism in its manufacturing outlook.

items.headline: First Solar Drops on Disappointing Profit
items.summary: First Solar ($FSLR) experienced a 14.2% drop after reporting a weaker profit than analysts had expected.

items.headline: Waaree Energies Falls on U.S. Tariffs
items.summary: Waaree Energies saw a significant decline of 10.4% after the United States imposed preliminary duties on solar imports from India.

items.headline: Nvidia Q4 Earnings in Focus Post-Market
items.summary: Nvidia ($NVDA) is set to report its highly anticipated fourth-quarter earnings after the market closes today. Analysts project a surge in Q4 earnings of over 70% and Q1 earnings growth nearing 99%, with expected revenues around $65.56 billion. The report is considered a key indicator for the broader AI sector.

items.headline: Positive Economic Data Supports Market Sentiment
items.summary: Recent economic data showed U.S. private employers increased employment in early February, and wholesale inventories rose by 0.2% in December. Furthermore, consumer confidence improved to 91.2 in February from 89 in January, exceeding analyst forecasts.

items.headline: Anthropic's New AI Integrations Lift Software Stocks
items.summary: Anthropic launched new artificial intelligence integrations aimed at enterprise customers, easing fears of software disruption and boosting shares of companies like Salesforce ($CRM), which rose 4.1%, and DocuSign ($DOCU), up 2.6%.

items.headline: President Trump's Policy Signals and Tariff Comments Impact Markets
items.summary: President Donald Trump's 2026 State of the Union address included policy proposals such as a government-backed 401(k) and a call to ban institutional investors from buying single-family homes. However, renewed tariff-focused comments also reignited global trade concerns.

items.headline: Federal Reserve Holds Rates Steady
items.summary: The Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) is widely expected to have held the federal funds rate target range steady at 3.50%–3.75% at its January 27–28, 2026 meeting, marking the second consecutive pause after three 25-basis-point cuts in late 2025.
